intro: Robiquetia flexa, commonly known as the flexible rosybell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Robiquetia flexa thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
